description: From French bastille, from Late Latin bastilia, plural of bastile, from bastire (“to build”).

examples: Thither arriv'd, th' advent'rous Knight / And bold Squire from their Steeds alight, / At th' outward Wall, near which there stands / A Bastile, built t' imprison Hands [...].

verbs.description: bastille (third-person singular simple present bastilles, present participle bastilling, simple past and past participle bastilled)

entries.meaning: To confine as though in a bastille; to imprison.
